Music Theory Pedagogy Workshop is a five-day workshop at NYU Steinhardt that focuses on teaching music theory & aural skills at the undergraduate level. The workshop is open to college & high school music instructors, as well as interested graduate students who wish to develop their classroom teaching techniques. A broad range of topics will be covered, including syllabus & lesson plan design, techniques for teaching written theory & aural skills, using technology effectively, creative ways for assessing student's skills, & more. Participants will work with a dedicated & experienced music theory pedagogue, & will have the opportunity to practice their teaching skills over the course of the week, receiving feedback from both the faculty member & other workshop participants.
